articles.author: Yousef Saba, Rachna Uppal
articles.description: Saudi Arabia faces the risk of an economic contraction this year following its decision to extend crude production cuts, highlighting its still heavy reliance on oil as reforms to diversify are slow moving.
articles.title: Analysis: Oil cut extension raises risk of Saudi economic contraction this year

articles.author: David Randall
articles.description: A potential U.S. government shutdown at the end of September could add to worries about the economy going into year-end and beyond, investors said.
articles.title: Analysis: Potential US government shutdown could dent investor confidence

articles.author: Munsif Vengattil, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RELI.NS) has begun exploring a foray into semiconductor manufacturing, a move that could address its supply chain needs and cater to growing chip demand in India, two people familiar with its strategy said.
articles.title: Exclusive: India's Reliance explores chipmaking foray, talking with potential partners -sources

articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.description: OpenAI's ChatGPT, the wildly popular artificial intelligence chatbot launched in November, saw monthly website visits decline for the third month in a row in August, though there are signs the decline is coming to an end, according to analytics firm Similarweb.
articles.title: Exclusive: ChatGPT traffic slips again for third month in a row

articles.author: Munsif Vengattil
articles.description: U.S. chip firm Nvidia and India's Reliance on Friday said they have formed a partnership to create AI language models and generative apps for millions of telecom users of the Indian company.
articles.title: Nvidia, India's Reliance strike AI partnership for apps, language models

articles.author: Hadeel Sayegh, Andres Gonzalez, Belén Carreño
articles.description: Jose Maria Alvarez-Pallete, chairman and chief executive of debt laden Spanish telephone and internet service company Telefonica, got an unexpected call this week when he was in Silicon Valley to meet companies and investors in America's tech capital.
articles.title: How Saudis quietly built influence at Spain's Telefonica

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Washington and Beijing are in a contest to develop AI-controlled weapons that will operate autonomously. The outcome could decide the global balance of power.
articles.title: In U.S.-China AI contest, the race is on to deploy killer robots

articles.author: Aditya Soni, David Shepardson
articles.description: Beijing's widening curbs on iPhone use by government staff raised concerns among U.S. lawmakers on Thursday and fanned fears that American tech companies heavily exposed to China could take a hit from rising tensions between the countries.
articles.title: China's widening iPhone curbs roil US technology sector

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies began arriving in New Delhi on Friday for their annual gathering as negotiators struggled to bridge differences over the war in Ukraine, seeking to build consensus for a successful summit host India wants.
articles.title: G20 members struggle for consensus on Ukraine as India gears up for summit
